Region: Calabria
Province: Reggio
Town: Reggio di Calabria
Name: Regio Antiquarium
harvard_short_list_text: Archaeological section, Greek antiquities; medieval section, medieval antiquities.

Region: Calabria
Province: Reggio
Town: Gerace Marina
Name: Museum
harvard_short_list_text: Greek antiquities.

Region: Campania
Province: Avellino
Town: Montevergine
Name: Convent of Montevergine
Alternate Name: Mt. of the Virgin Convent
harvard_short_list_text: Famous pilgrimage center. Festivals, Whitsuntide (7th Sunday after Easter); September 7-8th.

Province: Benevento
Town: Benevento
Name: Arco di Traiano
Alternate Name: Aroh of Trajan
harvard_short_list_text: Also called Port' Aurea, Roman triumphal arch.

Province: Benevento
Town: Benevento
Name: Cattedrale
harvard_short_list_text: Famous bronze doors, 13th century; treasury;

Province: Benevento
Town: Benevento

Alternate Name: Cathedral Library
harvard_short_list_text: Over 40 manuscripts, 9th to 13th century.

Region: Campania
Province: Benevento
Town: Cusano Mutri
Name: San Nicola
Alternate Name: Church of St. Nicholas
harvard_short_list_text: Silver reliquary, XIV century, containing part of crown of thorns.

Region: Campania
Province: Benevento
Town: Pescolamazza
Name: San Salvatore
Alternate Name: Church of the Holy Savior
harvard_short_list_text: Containing the body of the martyr St. Reparata, much revered.

Region: Campania
Province: Naples
Town: Napoli
Name: Cattedrale
Alternate Name: San Gennaro Cathedral
harvard_short_list_text: Dedicated to San Gennaro (St. Januarius), patron saint of Naples.
In the Chapel of San Gennaro and in the treasury two small vessels con-
taining the Saint's blood. On the first Saturday in May at the Church of Santa Chiara, and on September 19th and December 16th at the Cathedral,
ceremonies take place at which the blood liquifies, attracting enormous crowds.

Region: Campania
Province: Naples
Town: Napoli
Name: Santa Chiara
Alternate Name: St. Clara
harvard_short_list_text: XIV century tombs. First Saturday in May, liquification of the blood of St. Januarius (see above under Cattedrale).

Region: Campania
Province: Naples
Town: Napoli
Name: Santa Maria del Carmine
Alternate Name: Carmelite Church of St. Mary
harvard_short_list_text: Miraculous statue of the Virgin on the high altar.

Region: Campania
Province: Naples
Town: Napoli
Name: Catacombe di San Gennaro
harvard_short_list_text: Via San Gennaro dei Poveri.

Region: Campania
Province: Naples
Town: Napoli
Name: Monastero di San Martino
Alternate Name: Monastery of St. Martin
harvard_short_list_text: Church, sacristy and museum. Baroque paintings.

Region: Campania
Province: Naples
Town: Napoli
Name: Museo Nasionale
harvard_short_list_text: Contains most of the objects found in Pompei and Hereulaneum. The most important museum of classical antiquities in the world.

Region: Campania
Province: Naples
Town: Napoli
Name: Regia Universitia degli Studi
Alternate Name: University of Naples
harvard_short_list_text: Biblioteca Universitaria: 610,000 books, 117 manuscripts, engravings, early printed books, early editions, illustrated books on Dante. National property.

Region: Campania
Province: Naples
Town: Napoli
Name: Biblioteca Nazionale
Alternate Name: National Library
harvard_short_list_text: 1,270,000 books, 10,647 manuscripts, 4,500 engravings.

Region: Campania
Province: Naples
Town: Bacoli
Name: Piscina Mirabile
harvard_short_list_text: Largest and best preserved Roman water reservoir, built for the Roman fleet stationed in Misenum.

Province: Napoli
Town: Capri

harvard_short_list_text: Buried by the same eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in 79 A.D. that buried Pompeii; partly excavated.

Region: Campania
Province: Napoli
Town: Pompeii
Name: Ancient Pompeii
harvard_short_list_text: The most famous ruins of a Roman town, buried during the eruption of Mt. Vesuvius in 79 A.D., now largely excavated. Museum within excavations.

Town: Pozzuoli

harvard_short_list_text: Two Roman amphitheaters; so-called Tempio di Serapide.

Region: Campania
Province: Salerno
Town: Paestum
Name: Tempio di Cerere
Alternate Name: Temple of Ceres
harvard_short_list_text: Among most important monuments of Italy. Original Greek town walls, Roman theatre, forum, amphitheater; small museum with the finds from the temple of Hera at the mouth of the River Sele.

Region: Campania
Province: Salerno
Town: Ravello
Name: Duomo San Pantaleone
harvard_short_list_text: Famous bronze doors, fine pulpit. Festival at which the Saint's blood liquifies, July 27.

Region: Lazio
Province: Roma
Town: Rome
Name: Forum Romanum
harvard_short_list_text: Literally; Roman Market-Place, including Museo del Foro (Museum of the Forum). Area of excavations still in progress. Center of public life and administration of Justice in ancient Rome.

Region: Lazio
Province: Roma
Town: Rome
Name: Palatine Hill
harvard_short_list_text: Excavations still in progress. The cradle of Rome, and site of the palaces of ancient Imperial Rome.

Region: Lazio
Province: Roma
Town: Rome
Name: Fori Imperiali
harvard_short_list_text: The Fora (business and judicial centres) built by Caesar and Augustus, Norva and Trajan, with the Mercati di Trajano (market of Trajan) Basilion of Constantine and ancient street behind it.

Region: Lazio
Province: Roma
Town: Rome
Name: Colosseum
Alternate Name: Flavian Amphitheatre
harvard_short_list_text: The monumental Amphitheatre of Flavius. Area of excavations connected by Via dell' Impero.

Province: Rome
Town: Grottaferrata
Name: Abbey
harvard_short_list_text: Founded 1004, fortified by Pope Julius II, 1486. Church, mosaics and frescoes 11,000 books, and at a later period, collections of early Greek and Roman antiquities.

Town: Subiaco

Town: Velletri
Name: Partially excavated
harvard_short_list_text: Temple of Apollo; Roman street; "Ponte Sodo"; Tomba Campana; Wall of citadel (called Plaza d'Arm). 

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Frosinone
Town: Alatri
Name: Walls of large stone blocks
harvard_short_list_text:Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Anagni
Name: Duomo (Cathedral)
harvard_short_list_text: Founded in 11th century, rebuilt 14th, mosaics; treasury

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Anagni
Name: Museum
harvard_short_list_text: Cathedral Library and Archives, manuscripts and charters, many papal.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Arpino
Name: Citadel of Ancient Arpino
harvard_short_list_text: With imposing walls and gate.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Cassino (Monte Cassino)
Name: Roman Theater
harvard_short_list_text: 

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Cassino (Monte Cassino)
Name: Abbey of Monte Casino
Alternate Name: Monte Casino Abbey
harvard_short_list_text: Founded by St. Benedict in 629 A.D. Church (17th-18th century), 11th century bronze door; monastic buildings; picture gallery, one of the greatest monastic libraries, 20,000 books, 1,000 manuscripts (including the 6th century "Ambrosinater"), rich collection of charters and autographs. National property administered by the monks of the Abbey.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Perentino
Name: Porta Sanguinaria
harvard_short_list_text: Pre-Roman.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Cori
Name: Temple of Hercules and its altar
harvard_short_list_text: Partly incorporated in Church of San Pietro.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Fornia
Name: Remains of Roman villa
harvard_short_list_text: Supposed to have belonged to Clodius, in Villa Rubino.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Gaeta
Name: Duomo
harvard_short_list_text: Easter candlestick (c.1200); banner of Don John of Austria. In Archivio del Duomo, 3 Burnt Rolls, 11th-12th century. Near the City: Tomb of Munatius Planous (called Torre d'Orlando).

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Ninfa
Name: Ruins of medieval often
harvard_short_list_text: Mainly 12-18th century, with castle of the Caetini, two churches, and monastery.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Norma
Name: Ruins of ancient Norba
harvard_short_list_text: Including citadel, walls, two temples, aqueduct.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Priverno (formerly Piperno)
Name: Abbazia di Fossanova
Alternate Name: Fossanova Abbey
harvard_short_list_text: 12th-13th century with cloisters and monastic buildings, where Thomas Aquinas died, 1274.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Terracina
Name: Forum (Piazza del Municipio)
harvard_short_list_text: With inscribed pavement and Cathedral (12th century) incorporating temple.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Littoria
Town: Terracina
Name: Temple of Jupiter Anxur
harvard_short_list_text: Chief annuary of Terracina.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Viterbo
Name: Chiesa di Santissima Trinita
Alternate Name: Church of the Most Holy Trinity
harvard_short_list_text: And adjacent cloister.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Viterbo
Name: Palazzo Papale
harvard_short_list_text: With Loggia, scene of 3 papal elections, 18th century.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Viterbo
Name: Piazza San Pellegrino
harvard_short_list_text: With medieval houses including Casa Posola, Palazzo degli Alessandri; adjacent, San Pellegrino quarter with many medieval houses.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Viterbo
Name: Museo Civico
harvard_short_list_text: In old monastery church of S. Maria della Verita; antiquities; paintings by Lorenzo da Viterbo.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Bolsena
Name: Chiesa di Santa Cristina
harvard_short_list_text: (11th-16th century); Renaissance sculpture, museum with Etruscan monuments; catacombs of St. Cristina and her tomb. Scene of the Miracle of Bolsena in 1263 (appearance of blood on the host) which led to institution of festival of Corpus Christi.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Faleria (Malleri, Paleris)
Name: Ruins of Roman city of Faleria
harvard_short_list_text: With well-preserved wall.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Montalto di Castro
Name: Remains of Etruscan city of Vulci
harvard_short_list_text: Walls, temple, bath, tombs.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Tarquinia (Corneto)
Name: Palazzo Vitelleschi
harvard_short_list_text: (18th-16th century), with Museo Nazionale Tarquiniese, important Etruscan collection. Environa: Etruscan cemetery, with painted tombs.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Tuscania (formerly Tosonnelin)
Name: Chiesa di San Pietro
harvard_short_list_text: (VIII-XII centuries); choir screen, 11th century frescoes.

Region: Lazio (Latium)
Province: Viterbo
Town: Vetralla
Name: Etruscan Necropolis of Norchia
harvard_short_list_text:Region: Unknown
Province: Ascoli Piceno
Town: Ascoli Piceno
Name: Duomo
Alternate Name: Sant'Emidio
harvard_short_list_text: Main altar, choir stalls, bishop's throne, altarpiece (Crivelli); treasury. Baptistery (12th cent), font.

Region: Unknown
Province: Ascoli Piceno
Town: Ascoli Piceno
Name: Palazzo Apostolico
harvard_short_list_text: With museum; paintings, tapestries, ceramics. Pilgrimages on all festivals of Virgin, especially September 8.

Region: Unknown
Province: Ascoli Piceno
Town: San Francesco
harvard_short_list_text: Palazzo Comunale with Pinacoteca and Museo Civico; prehistoric and Roman antiquities, wrought iron, vestments.

Region: Unknown
Province: Macerata
Town: Macerata
Name: Pinacoteca
harvard_short_list_text: Paintings, ceramics.

Region: Unknown
Province: Macerata
Town: Macerata
Name: Biblioteca Comunale
Alternate Name: Municipal Library
harvard_short_list_text: 117,000 books, 609 manuscripts; materials dealing with Dante and civil and ecclesiastical history of the region.

Region: Unknown
Province: Macerata
Town: Recanati
Name: Duomo
Alternate Name: San Flaviano
harvard_short_list_text: Treasury.

Region: Unknown
Province: Macerata
Town: Palazzo Leopardi
harvard_short_list_text: Home of the great Italian poet with his private library, 26,000 books; autographs and documents.

Region: Unknown
Province: Pesaro and Urbino
Town: Pesaro
Name: Palazzo Ducale
harvard_short_list_text: Collinga. Pinacoteca and museum of ceramics.

Region: Unknown
Province: Pesaro and Urbino
Town: Pesaro
Name: Museo Oliveriano
harvard_short_list_text: Prehistoric and Roman antiquities, medieval and Renaissance sculpture, paintings and ceramics; library; 75,000 books, 200 manuscripts (16 illuminated). Property of private association. Environa: Villa Imperiales frescoes, courts, gardens.

Region: Unknown
Province: Pesaro and Urbino
Town: Urbino
Name: San Domenico
harvard_short_list_text: Portal with terra cotta relief.

Region: Unknown
Province: Pesaro and Urbino
Town: Fano
Name: Triumphal arch of Augustus
Alternate Name: Arested Augustus
harvard_short_list_text: Erected A.D. 9.

Region: Toscana
Province: Arezzo
Town: Arezzo
Name: Duomo
harvard_short_list_text: Sculpture, especially richly decorated tombs.

Region: Toscana
Province: Arezzo
Town: Arezzo
Name: Pieve di Santa Maria in Gradi
harvard_short_list_text: Altarpiece by Lorenzetti.

Region: Toscana
Province: Arezzo
Town: San Francesco
harvard_short_list_text: Famous frescoes by Piero della Francesca.

Region: Toscana
Province: Arezzo
Town: Liceo
harvard_short_list_text: Prehistoric, Etruscan and Roman (Aretine pottery) collections; paintings; library with early manuscripts.

Region: Toscana
Province: Cortona
Town: Duomo
Alternate Name: Santa Maria
harvard_short_list_text: Roman sarcophagus; paintings; vestments.

Region: Toscana
Province: Cortona
Town: Battistero (Chiesa del Ges√π)
harvard_short_list_text: Paintings by Fra Angelico.

Region: Toscana
Province: Cortona
Town: San Domenico
harvard_short_list_text: Paintings by Angelico, Sassetta, Signorelli.
